record.field: 1. Which of the following is true for CBT?
A. It stands for Computer Based Training
B. It is a form of E-learning
2. Which of the following is true about Job boards?
A. They are run only for technical positions
B. Centralized places where employers publicize vacant positions available with them
3. A talent management plan aims at developing which of the following quality(ies) in employees:
4. What are the parameters to judge the efficiency of the HR Process in an organization?
A. When more than one authorized users are using the data at a time
6. Which of the following is true for Fair wage?
A. It lays down minimum wages to be paid to each category of workers
B. It secures workers from exploitation
A. An approach in which workers are facilitated with humanity at the workplace.
B. A shared teamwork between the employee and the employer for solving problematic issues.
C. Forming a group of people on the work front so as to inspire them to work collectively for the company's growth in terms of social, economic, and psychological productivity.
8. Wage Structure describes wage and salary relationships within a particular _____
9. What do you call a central repository of data?
10. Which of the following is not a focus of the Wage and Salary programme?
11. Which of the following is true about the Opportunity Cost Method?
A. It was developed by Rensis Likert
B. It is used to value employees with rare skills and short supply
12. Which of the following testing techniques has a relation with disabled people?
A. Collecting data on head counts
B. Recording the vital stats of all the employees
C. Identifying and measuring data related to Human Resources
D. Knowing the exact number of workers in the organization
14. _______ recruitment provides the advantage of autonomy and flexibility to every department.
15. A wage committee should be ______ by the advice of the technical staff.
16. Which of the following is true about HR Metrics?
A. Focuses on the employee relations area
B. Create proactive plans to prevent the loss of top talent
C. Measures activities involved in the stages to attract and select top talent
17. _______ testing technique tests the basic components of a software system and ensures that all of them are working well.
18. Which of the following deals further with data security, safety and data validation?
19. What do you call the people who ultimately use the software?
20. As per which of the following methods, the human resource is valued on the basis of the contribution they are likely to make to the organization till retirement.
21. Organization adopts the practices that work most effectively for it rather than adopting industry wide best practices.this statement is related to _____
22. Recruitment Module begins with the Functionality of _____
23. Traditional HR activities involve HR programs such as planning, recruiting, selection, training, compensation, and performance management.
24. Transactional HR activities record keeping are important but add little value to the competitive position of the organization.
25. A capital budgeting metric in which the flow of benefits that result from an investment is compared with the cost of the investment. This statement related to_____
26. Best-practice” approach to strategic HRM is used by researchers in which organizations adopt industry-recognized best practices and use them in their organization.
28. Some of the Key Features of Organization Management would be:
A. Multiple views of organization chart
B. Maintenance of Dotted or Matrix Line Relationships
C. Enable Organization Unit - Position - Employee Relationship
29. mmy wanted to transfer an employee from one organization unit to another. Which module would Jimmy use in an HRIS?
A. An approach in which workers are facilitated with humanity at the workplace.
B. A shared teamwork between the employee and the employer for solving problematic issues
C. Forming a group of people on the work front so as to inspire them to work collectively for the company's growth in terms of social, economic, and psychological productivity.
